<h3 id="X24">X(24)&nbsp;=&nbsp;PERSPECTOR OF ABC AND ORTHIC-OF-ORTHIC TRIANGLE</h3>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; sec A cos 2A : sec B cos 2B : sec C cos 2C
<br>
Tllrilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; sec A - 2 cos A : sec B - 2 cos B : sec C - 2 cos C
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; tan A cos 2A : tan B cos 2B : tan C cos 2C
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; tan A - sin 2A : tan B - sin 2B : tan C - sin 2C
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a(sec A - 2 cos A) : :
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a^2 (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 - 2 a^2 b^2 - 2 a^2 c^2)/(a^2 - b^2 - c^2) : :
<b><br>
X(24) = 6 X(2) + (J^2 - 5) X(3)<br>
X(24) = (a^2 - b^2 - c^2) (a^2 + b^2 - c^2) (a^2 - b^2 + c^2) X(3) + 2 a^2 b^2 c^2 X(4)
</b>
<p>
As a point on the Euler line, X(24) has Shinagawa coefficients (2F, -E - 2F).
</p>
<p>
Let A'B'C' be the orthic triangle.  Let A&Prime; = inverse-in-circumcircle of A', and define B'' and C'' cyclically.  The lines AA&Prime;, BB&Prime;, CC&Prime; concur in X(24).  (Randy Hutson, September 5, 2015)
</p>
<p>
X(24) = homothetic center of the tangential triangle and the triangle obtained by reflecting X(4) in the sidelines of ABC.</p>
<p>If you have The Geometer's Sketchpad, you can view <a href="X(24).gsp" class="bold">X(24)</a>.
<br>
If you have GeoGebra, you can view <a href="X(24).ggb"><b>X(24)</b></a>.
<p>

{40825, 41363}, {40981, 41371}, {43394, 43823}, {43818, 43829}
</p>
<p>
X(24) is the {X(3),X(4)}-harmonic conjugate of X(378). For a list of other harmonic conjugates of X(24), click <b>Tables</b> at the top of this page.
</p>
<p>
X(24) = reflection of X(4) in X(235)<br>
X(24) = isogonal conjugate of X(68)<br>
X(24) = isotomic conjugate of X(20563)<br>
X(24) = complement of X(37444)<br>
X(24) = complement of complement of X(31304)<br>
X(24) = anticomplement of X(11585)<br>
X(24) = perspector of ABC and reflection of X(4) in orthic triangle<br>
X(24) = {X(3),X(25)}-harmonic conjugate of X(4)<br>
X(24) = trilinear pole of line X(924)X(6753)<br>
X(24) = circumcircle-inverse of X(403)<br>
X(24) = orthocentroidal circle-inverse of X(1594)<br>
X(24) = orthoptic-circle-of-Steiner-inellipse-inverse of X(37981)<br>
X(24) = orthoptic-circle-of-Steiner-circumellipse-inverse of anticomplement of X(37929)<br>
X(24) = de-Longchamps-circle-inverse of anticomplement of X(37951)<br>
X(24) = X(249)-Ceva conjugate of X(112)<br>
X(24) = X(52)-cross conjugate of X(4)<br>
X(24) = crosspoint of X(107) and X(250)<br>
X(24) = crosssum of X(i) and X(j) for these (i,j): (6,161), (125,520), (637,638)<br>
X(24) = X(4)-Hirst inverse of X(421)<br>
X(24) = X(46)-of-orthic-triangle if ABC is acute<br>
X(24) = X(56)-of-the-tangential triangle if ABC is acute<br>
X(24) = tangential isogonal conjugate of X(1498)<br>
X(24) = exsimilicenter of circumcircle and tangential circle when ABC is acute (Yuda Chen, November 7, 2021)<br>
X(24) = insimilicenter of circumcircle and tangential circle when ABC is obtuse<br>
X(24) = inverse-in-polar-circle of X(2072)<br>
X(24) = homothetic center of tangential and circumorthic triangles<br>
X(24) = homothetic center of orthic and Kosnita triangles<br>
X(24) = X(i)-isoconjugate of X(j) for these (i,j):  (75,2351), (91,3)
</p>
